abstract: The president’s chief economic adviser did research years ago that found that investment tax credits often raised prices, rather than creating jobs, an economist writes.
snippet: The president’s chief economic adviser did research years ago that found that investment tax credits often raised prices, rather than creating jobs, an economist writes.
lead_paragraph: Casey B. Mulligan is an economics professor at the University of Chicago.

headline.main: Early Doubts About Whether Tax Credits Stimulate Investment
